title: San Antonio Snapper
ingredients: 1 small green bell pepper, seeded and diced
1 jalapeno pepper, seeded, de-veined and minced
1 pounds fresh ripe tomatoes, seeded and diced
1 teaspoon salt, plus more to taste
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste
1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, plus more to taste
1½ pounds red snapper fillets with skin
instructions: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat until hot.  Add the onion and bell pepper and cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently.  Stir in the jalapeno and garlic and cook for one more minute.  Stir in the tomatoes, 2 tablespoons of the cilantro, ½-teaspoon salt, ¼-teaspoon pepper, sugar, thyme, oregano and bay leaf.  Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove the bay leaf and simmer the sauce for 20-25 minutes more, or until thickened.  Stir in the lemon juice.  Taste and add additional salt, black pepper and lemon juice, if needed.
In a shallow bowl or plate, combine flour, the remaining salt and pepper.  Dip the fish fillets in the flour mixture to coat.

In a large skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium heat until hot.  Add the fish, skin side down, making sure the fillets do not touch each other.  Cook the fish for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown.  Transfer the cooked fish onto a paper towel lined platter to drain.
Serve the fish fillets immediately with the sauce spooned over the top and garnished with the remaining 2 tablespoons of cilantro.
Source:    Recipe Extra, San Antonio Express-News, Wednesday, March 17, 1999.
